security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/prompt-based skill that provides workflow guidance. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access, no external commands. All operations are delegated to other skills via the Task tool.

content.user_title: Execute plans with subagents and reviews
content.value_statement: Implementing multi-step plans manually wastes time and risks errors. This skill automates execution by dispatching fresh subagents per task with automatic code reviews, ensuring quality while maintaining session context.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches fresh subagent for each independent task
Executes code review after every task completion
Maintains session context across all tasks
Automatically fixes issues found in code reviews
Runs final comprehensive review after all tasks
limitations: Requires plan file created by writing-plans skill first
Not suitable for tightly coupled tasks requiring manual coordination
Cannot revise plans mid-execution without brainstorming first

use_cases.title: Implement complex features
use_cases.description: Execute multi-file feature implementations with automated quality gates at each step

use_cases.title: Run automated CI/CD tasks
use_cases.description: Dispatch infrastructure tasks with verification and review checkpoints

use_cases.title: Manage large refactors
use_cases.description: Coordinate refactoring across modules with consistent code review standards

prompt_templates.title: Start plan execution
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using Subagent-Driven Development to execute the plan at [plan-file]. Load the plan and create TodoWrite with all tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Dispatch first task
prompt_templates.prompt: Dispatch a fresh implementation subagent for Task 1: [task name]. Use test-driven-development for implementation and ensure tests pass.

prompt_templates.title: Request code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use requesting-code-review to review the completed work. Base SHA: [commit before task], HEAD_SHA: [current commit]. Report issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Complete development branch
prompt_templates.scenario: Finish after all tasks pass review
prompt_templates.prompt: All tasks completed. Dispatch final code-reviewer to validate entire implementation. Then use finishing-a-development-branch skill to complete.

best_practices: Always create plans with writing-plans skill before using this workflow
Never skip code reviews between tasks, even for small changes
Use fresh subagents to avoid context pollution between tasks
anti_patterns: Skipping code review to save time leads to technical debt accumulation
Dispatching multiple implementation subagents in parallel causes conflicts
Proceeding with unfixed Critical issues risks production bugs

faq.question: What other skills does this skill require?
faq.answer: Requires writing-plans for plan creation, requesting-code-review for reviews, and finishing-a-development-branch for completion.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without a pre-existing plan?
faq.answer: No. This skill expects a plan file from writing-plans. Create a plan first or brainstorm to develop one.

faq.question: How does this differ from executing-plans skill?
faq.answer: This skill keeps you in the same session with fresh subagents. Executing-plans opens parallel sessions.

faq.question: Is my code safe during subagent execution?
faq.answer: Yes. All subagent work is reviewed before merging. Critical issues must be fixed before proceeding.

faq.question: What happens if a subagent fails its task?
faq.answer: Dispatch a fix subagent with specific instructions. Do not try to fix manually to avoid context pollution.

faq.question: Can I use this for tightly coupled tasks?
faq.answer: No. This workflow works best for independent tasks. Use manual execution for tightly coupled tasks.
